block.p: Southern University, a football powerhouse among historically black colleges, needed a quarterback. But when the coaches recruited a white athlete for the position, many on campus found it hard to swallow. How Race Is Lived in America: the 11th article of a series.
Plus: A mentor to a group of young New Yorkers felt good about giving her time, but found that she was no substitute for government services. A report in The Times Magazine.
